pros: Progression (pay and position) Pension scheme Holiday entitlement
cons: Short staff Weekend /evening work

job_title: Waiting List Coordinator in Leicester, England
pros: rewarding job. Made one or two friends.
cons: Worst job ever. Please do not work as a waiting list coordinator for uhl. I worker for the endoscopy department which is one of that worst departments. There is zero direction, management have no idea what they are doing, the work is overwhelming and it’s impossible to get your work done when you constantly have nurses interrupting you and phone lines are ringing always. There is hardly any training given to staff, the training seemed to be all over the place because management couldn’t be bothered setting up accurate training prior to starting your job. There is a huge staff turnover and there is also a bullying culture in this department.

pros: Job safety, no one can just sack you overnight (unless you are truly not doing anything). Pension and long service recognition. A place full of opportunities if only one had the time and the management permission to self-develop. The CEO is visibly trying to change the organisation for the better and bring a true corporate identity, work style and performance levels.
cons: Too much bullying, incompetence and resistance to change. Too low wages for too high expectations in terms of skills and competences. Talent support inexistant; the better you are, the more they use you and backstab you. Professional development and extra training are the very last priority within the administration teams. Mental burnout is the state of the day, every day.
